pages.text:
Title: Is the Price Tag on the Doctorate Too High?

Abstract: * Since today's emphasis on advanced education is reflected in both salary schedules and basic qualifications for teaching positions in schools at all levels, increasing numbers of teachers are entering doctoral programs. Yet the personal and practical considerations that play such an important role in determining the success of a doctoral candidate are usually not described in graduate school bulletins. An understanding of some of the problems involved in obtaining a doctorate is essential if you are planning to continue your education. Top priority must be given to a critical evaluation of your ambitions and achievements. What significant professional accomplishments do you have? What are your professional plans for the near future? Are they part of your long-term aspirations? Are they practical, considering your performance to date? What is your present status in professional circles? Could further study or an advanced degree assist you in reaching desired goals? Your relations to family, friends, and the community are also significant. Have you attained your goals in these areas? What is your present financial position? What does the financial future hold? Perhaps the most important matter to consider is your physical and emotional health. If this self-evaluation reveals that

Keywords: Mathematics education, Psychology, Pedagogy
